summary:
Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport, also known as Roissy Airport, is Paris' main international airport. It opened in 1974 and is located 23 km northeast of the city. Named after World War II leader Charles de Gaulle, it serves as a hub for Air France and many other airlines.

In 2022, the airport handled over 57 million passengers, making it one of the world's busiest airports. It is the busiest airport in the European Union and a major cargo hub, handling over 2 million tonnes in 2019. The airport offers flights to numerous countries and is operated by Groupe ADP.
title: Charles de Gaulle Airport
